crissyfield1.description: Crissy Field in San Francisco is the perfect beach for toddlers.
crissyfield1.title: Crissyfield 1

crissyfield2.description: Felix could walk across the river.  Milo needed a little help.
crissyfield2.title: Crissyfield 2

crissyfield4.description: Crissy Field is part of the Presidio, which was a U.S. Army post until 1994.   Did they have camouflage surfboards?
crissyfield4.title: Crissyfield 4

grass1.description: Busy Papa = unmown grass. Felix likes to pretend he is a tiger.
grass1.title: Grass 1

nana.description: Nana came for a visit.  She brought Felix a kid-sized mouse and taught him how to use it. By the end of the day, he had gotten good at it. Milo, of course, wanted a piece of the action.
nana.title: Nana

raffle1.description:
We threw another lemonade stand in a valiant attempt to sell more raffle tickets. We only sold 4, but it was good times.
We did eventually manage to sell all our tickets to friends and family and Yogamoms. Thanks everyone!
raffle1.title: Raffle 1

raffle2.description:
The New School had its International Fair, for which we sold all those raffle tickets.
The fair featured entertainment and food from around the world, including...
raffle2.title: Raffle 2

raffle3.description: The French booth was très authentic. Lucie's crèpes were a huge success.
raffle3.title: Raffle 3

description:
Milo's starting to talk about things that happened in the (near) past. He saw Torin's dad today and told Dean all about it upon arriving home 10 minutes later: "Papa Torin! Papa Torin!".

He's quickly advancing on many linguistic fronts: speaking more French to Lucie, speaking more two-word sentences, and a vocabulary that's months and months past any attempt at cataloguing.

Lucie got a new contract job. It's a great gig, but it's full time, so both kids will be at nanny/school all week for five weeks or so. (Usually Felix gets a Mom day on Wednesday, and Milo gets it Monday and Wednesday.)
title: May 1
